description: Construction of a four storey building for temporary use as a marketing suite including associated landscaping and parking (Temporary Consent for 15 years)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be limited for a period of 15 years expiring on 28 March 2034 when the building(s) and works carried out under this permission shall be removed and the land reinstated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: The temporary nature of the development is such that it is considered inappropriate on a permanent basis in the interests of the regeneration of this important startegic site and in accordance with Policy SOU5 of the adopted Ealing Development Sites, DPD, 2013. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: 'Southall Waterside, Sales and Marketing Suite, Design and Access Statement dated November 2018' as prepared by Levitt Bernstein architects; 'Southall Waterside, Sales and Marketing Suite,Travel Plan dated November 2018' as prepared by Vectos;  'Southall Waterside, Sales and Marketing Suite, Transport Statement dated November 2018' as prepared by Vectos;  'Southall Waterside, Sales and Marketing Suite, Delivery and Servicing Management Plan dated November 2018' as prepared by Vectos;  'Southall Waterside, Sales and Marketing Suite, Daylight and Sunlight Report, reference AJ/MC/ROL7163 dated November 2018' as prepared by Anstey Horne Chartered Surveyors.

Drawing Numbers A727-E02-MA-XX-LVB-A-PL-0001 Revision P3; A727-E02-MA-04-LVB-A-PL-0104 Revision P6; A727-E02-MA-00-LVB-A-PL-0200 Revision P7; A727-E02-MA-01-LVB-A-PL-0201 Revision P4; A727-E02-MA-04-LVB-A-PL-0204 Revision P3; A727-E02-MA-00-LVB-A-PL-0300 Revision P9; A727-E02-MA-01-LVB-A-PL-0301 Revision P7; A727-E02-MA-02-LVB-A-PL-0302 Revision P7; A727-E02-MA-03-LVB-A-PL-0303 Revision P8; A727-E02-MA-RF-LVB-A-PL-0304 Revision P2; A727-E02-MA-ELE-LVB-A-ELE-0400 Revision P3; A727-E02-MA-ELE-LVB-A-ELE-0401 Revision P3; A727-E02-MA-ELE-LVB-A-ELE-0402 Revision P3; A727-E02-MA-ELE-LVB-A-ELE-0403 Revision P3 and A727-E02-MA-XX-LVB-A-SEC-0500 Revision P3 all as prepared by Levitt Bernstein.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before the sub-structure and superstructure are completed.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: To ensure that the materials are of a high quality specification and make a positive contribution to the townscape in accordance with Policies 7.1, 7.3 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD (2012); and Policies 7.3 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The premises shall not be open to members of the public outside of the hours 08:00 - 22:00, Monday to Saturday and 10:00 - 17:00 on Sundays.

REASON: To protect the amenity of nearby occupants in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012 and Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013. | Details of any external lighting scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved building.  The external lighting scheme shall be designed to comply with the advice given at BS 5389 Part 9, with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of the public amenity areas including the roof terraces/areas and ILE guidance on 'Reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2005'.  The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the guidance and the approved scheme and be retained thereafter.

REASON: In the interests of protecting the living conditions of neighbouring residents from intrusive light spill and also ensuring that sufficient light is provided to the areas of public realm and to building entrances in the interests of safety and security, in accordance with Policy 7.13 of the London Plan, 2016; Policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD 2012 and policies 7A and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Full details of foundation design including a method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development and shall take place in strict accordance with details approved pursuant to this condition.

REASON: To ensure that the development is brought forward in accordance with the approved Written Scheme Remediation Strategy and Options Appraisal Issue 7 dated 8 July 2015 under LPA approved reference PP/2014/4729 dated 15.07.2015 in accordance with Policy 5.21 of the London Plan, 2016; Policy 1.1(e) and (j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012 and Policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013. | Details of hard landscaping to be used on paving, parking areas and means of enclosure including samples and soft landscaping including tree protection and tree and shrub planting proposals shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority before the sub-structure and super-structure are completed.  The approved hard landscaping shall be fully implemented in accordance with those details prior to occupation of the building and be retained thereafter.  The approved soft landscaping shall be laid out and planted prior to the ocupation of the development.  Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season.

REASON: To ensure that the development would be of a high quality design standard and to be in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Policies 7.3, 7.4, 7.6, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2016; Policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012 and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013.

| The construction of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan and Scheme and Code of Practice in line with the Site Wide Construction Management Plan that was approved under LPA Reference PP/2016/0192 dated 09.05.2016 and the applicant, developer shall ensure that its contractors shall comply with its terms in order to minimise disturbances including noise but not limited to vibration, dust, smoke emanating from the site.

REASON: In the interests of minimising the impact of noise, vibration and airborne pollution on the amenities of occupiers within the vicinity of the site, to limit the works to reasonable hours and to minimise the impact of construction traffic on the highway network.  In accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan, 2016; Policies 1.1(j), (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; Ealing's SPG10: Noise and Vibration; SPG3: Air Quality; The control of dust and emissions during construction and demolition (July 2014); BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of Practice for Noise and Vibration Control on Construction and Open Sites - Part 1: Noise; the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended); The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2010; and Policy 5.2 of the adopted Ealing Develoment Management DPD, 2013. | The building hereby approved is not be occupied until the approved eastern access road is constructed.
Reason:  To ensure that satisfactory vehicular access is obtained for general safety on the adjoining highway and to accord with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan, 2016.

| Prior to first occupation of the development, a Servicing Management Plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include hours of use, times and frequency of activities, deliveries and collections, vehicle movements, silent reversing methods, location of loading bays, quiet loading/unloading measures etc. and compliance with best practice guidance by DfT and FTA.  The approved details shall thereafter be fully implemented for the life of the approved development.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, fumes, etc. in accordance with Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013. | The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact.  The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013.
